TITLE: Despite stock market losses, investors may get year-end mutual fund payouts. That can trigger a surprise tax bill.
SUMMARY: Despite stock market losses in 2022, investors may receive year-end mutual fund distributions, which can trigger a tax bill.

TITLE: The Powerball jackpot is $1.9 billion only if you take the annuity. Here's why the lump sum may be overrated
SUMMARY: Hardly anyone opts for lottery annuity payments, but with $1.9 billion at stake, there are significant advantages to spreading out this Powerball windfall.

TITLE: The $1.9 billion Powerball jackpot — the largest ever — is up for grabs. Here's the tax bill if there's a winner
SUMMARY: A big slice of winnings would go to the IRS, as well as state coffers, depending on where the ticket was purchased and where you live.

TITLE: How to use pay transparency to negotiate a better salary
SUMMARY: New pay laws are making it easier for people to negotiate for higher salaries, whether in a new job or as a promotion. Here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Op-ed: Here are 3 year-end strategies for high-net-worth families to consider
SUMMARY: Here's a look at three financial-planning opportunities high-net-worth investors should not overlook amid the market drop as the year ends.

TITLE: Winning ticket for Powerball's record $2.04 billion jackpot sold in California — here's what will go to taxes
SUMMARY: The winner will face a 24% federal tax withholding, but whether there are state taxes due depends where the ticket holder lives.

TITLE: Consumers are cutting back on holiday gift buying amid higher inflation
SUMMARY: Shoppers are making fewer purchases, and at a discount, to combat higher prices this holiday season, several studies show.

TITLE: Op-ed: Here's a year-end checklist to help you navigate some complicated financial issues
SUMMARY: This year's end presents a lot of financial challenges, including inflation and market volatility. This checklist may help you navigate these complicated times.

TITLE: Here are the pros and cons of owning cryptocurrency in your 401(k) plan
SUMMARY: Fidelity Investments and ForUsAll began offering cryptocurrency to 401(k) investors within the past few months. They appear to be the first companies to do so.

TITLE: Powerball drawing held for record $2.04 billion jackpot after delay of hours
SUMMARY: The Powerball jackpot has topped $2 billion, a record for a lottery. But the drawing was delayed due to problems processing sales and play data in a state.

TITLE: As a key deadline looms to claim 2021 tax credits, Republicans complain of 'suspicious timing' of IRS letters
SUMMARY: Individuals and families who missed out on the $1,400 stimulus checks, child tax credit and earned income tax credit in 2021 still have time to claim.

TITLE: Voters approve higher minimum wage in Nebraska and Washington, D.C. Votes still being tallied in Nevada
SUMMARY: Voters in both Nebraska and the District of Columbia approved higher minimum wages, while the results in Nevada are still pending.

TITLE: From buy now, pay later to Venmo, here are 4 of the best ways to pay for holiday gifts
SUMMARY: With households increasingly cash-strapped this holiday season, how you spend is just as important as what you spend.

TITLE: 'Sirens should go off': How to avoid getting duped by Medicare scammers during open enrollment
SUMMARY: As beneficiaries are encouraged to review their coverage for 2023, fraudsters may try to capitalize on that and cast a broad net to lure in victims.

TITLE: Most Americans want to 'age in place' at home. Here's how to plan your support systems
SUMMARY: Retirement-focused financial advisors can help with both the financial and non-financial preparations for seniors looking to age in place at home.

TITLE: Massachusetts voters approve 'millionaire tax.' What it means for the wealthy
SUMMARY: Massachusetts voters approved a "millionaire tax" of 4% on annual income above $1 million, on top of the state's current 5% income tax. Here's what to know.

TITLE: It could be cheaper to dine out on Thanksgiving this year as CPI 'food at home' prices soar
SUMMARY: The cost of dining out rose just 8.6% over the last year, while the cost of eating at home jumped 12.4%, according to the latest consumer price index data.

TITLE: Could student loan forgiveness still happen this year? It's possible
SUMMARY: The White House remains unable to start processing the tens of millions of student loan forgiveness applications it's received. Here's what could happen next.

TITLE: Here’s the inflation breakdown for October 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Inflation rose less than expected in October, but consumer prices are still rising quickly for staples such as energy, food and shelter.

TITLE: This midterm election outcome is 'typically good for markets': What investors can expect
SUMMARY: Which parties control the House and Senate still has not been decided. But there are some lessons investors can take away from this week's midterm elections.

TITLE: Biden names pick for new IRS head as agency plans for $80 billion funding, wrestles with backlog
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden intends to nominate Danny Werfel to become the next IRS Commissioner, overseeing the plan for the agency's nearly $80 billion in funding.

TITLE: These 10 used cars have held their value the most
SUMMARY: The average 5-year-old car in 2022 has depreciated by 33.3%, although some models have fared far better, new research shows.

TITLE: You've been laid off — now what? Here are 3 steps to take if you lose your job
SUMMARY: Twitter and Meta recently laid off thousands. The job market is healthy, but some sectors are seeing layoffs. Here are three steps to consider if you're let go.

TITLE: Why egg prices are surging — but chicken prices are falling: It's an 'act of God' event, says trade strategist
SUMMARY: The price of eggs and chickens moved in opposite directions in October. Bird flu is a big reason why.

TITLE: The top 10 most-regretted college majors — and the degrees graduates wish they had pursued instead
SUMMARY: Graduates entering the workforce with good career prospects and high starting salaries are the most satisfied with their major, according to ZipRecruiter.

TITLE: Here are 4 ways to take advantage of your health-care expenses before the end of the year
SUMMARY: There are several ways you may be able to ease the sting of your 2022 health costs, according to experts. Here's a look at four approaches.
